Description: Marl clay vase with squared everted roll rim and a short narrow neck, with a barrel-shaped body and flat base. On the exterior surface there are remains of a pale grey slip, over which are red painted wavy lines at the level of the shoulder. Good condition.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Ceremonial Slate Palettes and Corpus of Protodynastic Pottery’ (London, 1953), 94k; F. Ll. Griffith, 'Liverpool Annals of Archaeology and Anthropology 8 (Liverpool, 1921), 13; 'Nubia - Los reinos del Nilo en Sudàn' (Exhibit catalogue) (2003). "Vaso" p.144 Cat. 45.
Bibliographic references: Shaw & Nicholson 1995 / British Museum Dictionary of Ancient Egypt (p17)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2003 10 Apr-31 Aug, Barcelona, CaixaForum, Nubia: Los reinos del Nilo en Sudan 2003/4 23 Sep-4 Jan, Madrid, Sala de Exposiciones de la Fundacio, Nubia: Los reinos del Nilo en Sudan
